content: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

content: Believe you can and you are halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

content: success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

content: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

content: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

content: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

content: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo

content: success is not the key to happiness. happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
author: Albert Schweitzer

content: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

content: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

content: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

content: success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston S. Churchill

content: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: It goes on.
author: Robert Frost

content: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value
author: Albert Einstein

content: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
author: Charles Kingsleigh (from Alice in Wonderland)

content: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

content: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

content: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

content: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life..
author: Steve Jobs

content: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vidal Sassoon

content: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.
author: Jordan Belfort

content: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

content: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack in will.
author: Vince Lombardi

content: I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.
author: Stephen R. Covey

content: It doesn't matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

content: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

content: Opportunities don't happen, you create them.
author: Chris Grosser

content: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
author: Matty Mullins

content: success is not about the destination, but the journey.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: Don't wait. The time will never be just right.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

content: In the midst of winter, I found there was, within me, an invincible summer.
author: Albert Camus

content: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

content: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
author: Audrey Hepburn

content: I have waited for this opportunity for more than half a century, to repeat to you once again my vow of eternal fidelity and everlasting love.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

content: Love is like the wind, you can't see it but you can feel it.
author: Nicholas Sparks

content: Love is not just looking at each other, it's looking in the same direction.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

content: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

content: The best love is the kind that awakens the soul and makes us reach for more, that plants a fire in our hearts and brings peace to our minds.
author: Nicholas Sparks

content: Love does not dominate; it cultivates.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness.
author: William Saroyan

content: Love is when the other person's happiness is more important than your own.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

content: Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.
author: Maya Angelou

content: I am in you and you in me, mutual in divine love.
author: William Blake

content: Love is the emblem of eternity; it confounds all notion of time; effaces all memory of a beginning, all fear of an end.
author: Madame de Stael

content: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: David Viscott

content: The best love is the kind that awakens the soul; that makes us reach for more, that plants the fire in our hearts and brings peace to our minds.
author: Nicholas Sparks

content: Love is the flower; you've got to let it grow.
author: John Lennon

content: Love is friendship that has caught fire.
author: Ann Landers

content: Love is an endless mystery, for it has nothing else to explain it.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

content: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
author: Victor Hugo

content: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
author: James Baldwin

content: The only thing we never get enough of is love; and the only thing we never give enough of is love.
author: Henry Miller

content: Love is not only something you feel, it is something you do.
author: David Wilkerson

content: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.
author: Robert Frost

content: Love is a friendship set to music.
author: Joseph Campbell

content: Love is the beauty of the soul.
author: Saint Augustine

content: I'll be the moon when the sun goes down, just so you know I'm always around.
author: Anonymous

content: I have late night conversations with the moon. He tells me about the sun and I tell him about you.
author: S.L. Gray

content: Love is like the moon, when it does not increase, it decreases.
author: Segovia Amil

content: The moon lives in the lining of your skin.
author: Pablo Neruda

content: I swear I couldn't love you more than I do right now, and yet I know I will tomorrow.
author: Leo Christopher

content: The moon, like a flower in heaven's high bower, with silent delight sits and smiles on the night.
author: William Blake

content: Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.
author: Mark Twain

content: Don't tell me the sky's the limit when there are footprints on the moon.
author: Paul Brandt

content: The moon looks upon many night flowers; the night flowers see but one moon.
author: Jean Ingelow

content: Nature is not a place to visit. It is home.
author: Gary Snyder

content: In all things of nature, there is something of the marvelous.
author: Aristotle

content: Nature is pleased with simplicity.
author: Isaac Newton

content: The earth has music for those who listen.
author: William Shakespeare

content: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

content: In every walk with nature, one receives far more than he seeks.
author: John Muir

content: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: In nature, nothing is perfect and everything is perfect. Trees can be contorted, bent in weird ways, and they're still beautiful.
author: Alice Walker

content: There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls.
author: George Carlin

content: The sky is the daily bread of the eyes
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Don't forget: Beautiful sunsets need cloudy skies.
author: Paulo Coelho

content: The sky is the ultimate art gallery just above us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: The sky is an infinite movie to me. I never get tired of looking at what's happening up there.
author: K.D.Lang

content: The sky broke like an egg into full sunset and the water caught fire.
author: Pamela Hansford Johnson

content: The sky is the limit. You never have the same experience twice.
author: Frank McCourt

content: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: When you arise in the morning, think of what a prcious privilege it is to be alive, to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Night is always darker before the dawn and life is the same, the hard times will pass, every thing will get better and sun will shine brighter then ever.
author: Ernesst Hemingway

content: The night walked down the sky with the moon in her hand.
author: Frederic Lawrence Knowles

content: Friendship is born at that moment when one person says to another, 'What! You too? I thought I was the only one.
author: C.S. Lewis

content: A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: True friendship comes when the silence between two people is comfortable.
author: David Tysonn

content: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
author: Woodrow Wilson

content: Friendship is the hardest thing in the world to explain. It's not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
author: Muhammad Ali

content: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
author: Helen Keller

content: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
author: Walter Winchell

content: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
author: Elie Wiesel

content: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
author: Jim Morrison

content: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

content: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

content: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate.
author: Linda Grayson

content: Friendship is like a rainbow between two hearts.
author: Anonymous

content: The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.
author: Elisabeth Foley

content: A friend is someone who understands your past, believes in your future, and accepts you just the way you are.
author: Anonymous

content: Friendship is not about who you've known the longest. It's about who walked into your life, said 'I'm here for you,' and proved it.
author: Anonymous

content: A friend is one who overlooks your broken fence and admires the flowers in your garden.
author: Anonymous

content: Friendship isn't about whom you have known the longest... It's about who came, and never left your side.
author: Anonymous

content: A true friend is someone who is there for you when they would rather be someplace else.
author: Len Wein

content: A friend is one that knows you as you are, understands where you have been, accepts what you have become, and still, gently allows you to grow.
author: William Shakespeare

content: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
author: Euripides

content: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
author: Euripides

content: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Success is not the key to happiness. happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
author: Albert Schweitzer

content: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
author: Bo Bennett

content: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.
author: Booker T. Washington

content: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
author: Colin R. Davis

content: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett

content: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

content: Success is not about getting everything right, but about never giving up.
author: Anonymous

content: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Euripides

content: Success is not just about making money. It's about making a difference.
author: Anonymous

content: Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds.
author: Orison Swett Mardent

content: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
author: Robert Collier

content: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.
author: Maya Angelou

content: The starting point of all achievement is desire.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: Success is not the destination, but the road that you're on. Being successful means that you're working hard and walking your walk every day. You can only live your dream by working hard towards it. That's living your dream.
author: Marlon Wayans

content: The greatest achievement was at first and for a time a dream. The oak sleeps in the acorn; the bird waits in the egg; and in the highest vision of the soul, a waking angel stirs. Dreams are the seedlings of realities.
author: James Allen

content: Success is the progressive realization of a worthy goal or ideal.
author: Earl Nightingale

content: Achievement seems to be connected with action. Successful men and women keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don't quit.
author: Conrad Hilton

content: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

content: The only way to find true happiness is to risk being completely cut open.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

content: Happiness is not a goal; it is a by-product.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: The most important thing is to enjoy your life - to be happy. It's all that matters.
author: Audrey Hepburn

content: The only joy in the world is to begin.
author: Cesare Pavese

content: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
author: Jim Rohn

content: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one does.
author: James M. Barrie

content: The only thing that will make you happy is being happy with who you are, and not who people think you are.
author: Goldie Hawn

content: Happiness is a direction, not a place.
author: Sydney J. Harris

content: Happiness is not having what you want. It is appreciating what you have.
author: Anonymous

content: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

content: Happiness is not something you find at the end of the road. It is here now, if you are wise enough to appreciate it.
author: Anonymous

content: Happiness is not the absence of problems, but the ability to deal with them.
author: Steve Maraboli

content: Happiness is a choice. You can choose to be happy. There's going to be stress in life, but it's your choice whether you let it affect you or not.
author: Valerie Bertinelli

content: The happiest people don't have the best of everything, they make the best of everything.
author: Anonymous

content: There is no path to happiness: happiness is the path.
author: Gautama Buddha

content: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

content: Happiness is letting go of what you think your life is supposed to look like and celebrating it for everything that it is.
author: Mandy Hale

content: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

content: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
author: Albert Einstein

content: The road to wisdom? Well, it's plain and simple to express: Err and err and err again but less and less and less.
author: Piet Hein

content: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov

content: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

content: The fool don't think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare

content: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.
author: Baltasar Gracián

content: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

content: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

content: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

content: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

content: The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
author: Albert Einstein

content: The beginning of wisdom is the definition of terms.
author: Socrates

content: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucius

content: The only source of knowledge is experience.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
author: Anton Chekhov

content: To know, is to know that you know nothing. That is the meaning of true knowledge.
author: Confucius

content: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
author: Confucius

content: Knowledge will bring you the opportunity to make a difference.
author: Claire Fagin

content: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.
author: Anaïs Nin

content: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

content: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

content: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

content: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

content: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.
author: Maya Angelou

content: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Life is short, and it is up to you to make it sweet.
author: Sarah Louise Delany

content: Life is a journey that must be traveled no matter how bad the roads and accommodations.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

content: Life is not about waiting for the storm to pass, but about learning to dance in the rain.
author: Vivian Greene

content: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

content: The biggest lesson I've learned is, 'It's okay.' It's okay for me to be kind to myself. It's okay to be wrong. It's okay to get mad. It's okay to be flawed. It's okay to be happy. It's okay to move on.
author: Hayley Williams

content: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
author: Henry Ford

content: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

content: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
author: Helen Keller

content: Life is too important to be taken seriously.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Life is inherently risky. There is only one big risk you should avoid at all costs, and that is the risk of doing nothing.
author: Denis Waitley

content: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

content: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

content: Peace begins with a smile.
author: Mother Teresa

content: Peace is not absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.
author: Ronald Reagan

content: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
author: Mother Teresa

content: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Peace is not something you wish for; it's something you make, something you do, something you are, and something you give away.
author: John Lennon

content: An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: Peace is a journey of a thousand miles and it must be taken one step at a time.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

content: The day the power of love overrules the love of power, the world will know peace.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Gautama Buddha

content: Peace is not the absence of trouble but the presence of God.
author: Anonymous

content: I never found the companion that was so companionable as solitude.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Solitude is the soul's holiday, an opportunity to stop doing for others and to surprise and delight ourselves instead.
author: Katrina Kenison

content: Solitude is independence.
author: Hermann Hesse

content: The greatest thing in the world is to know how to belong to oneself.
author: Michel de Montaigne

content: Solitude is where one discovers one is not alone.
author: Marty Rubin

content: Solitude is fine but you need someone to tell that solitude is fine.
author: Honoré de Balzac

content: It is better to be alone than in bad company.
author: George Washington

content: Solitude is often the best company.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

content: I live in that solitude which is painful in youth, but delicious in the years of maturity.
author: Albert Einstein

content: I think that I cannot preserve my health and spirits unless I spend four hours a day at least—and it is commonly more than that—sauntering through the woods and over the hills and fields, absolutely free from all worldly engagements.
author: Henry David Thoreau
